protocol_name: A new targeted capture method using bacterial artificial chromosome (BAC) libraries as baits for sequencing relatively large genes
protocol_name_html: A new targeted capture method using bacterial artificial chromosome (BAC) libraries as baits for sequencing relatively large genes
description: To analyze a specific genome region using next-generation sequencing technologies, the enrichment of DNA libraries with targeted capture methods has been standardized. For enrichment of mitochondrial genome, a previous study developed an original targeted capture method that use baits constructed from long-range polymerase chain reaction(PCR) amplicons, common laboratory reagents, and equipment. In this protocol, a new targeted capture method is presented, that of bacterial artificial chromosome (BAC) double capture (BDC), modifying the previous method, but using BAC libraries as baits for sequencing a relatively large gene.

materials.reagent_name: KAPA Library Quantification Kit for Illumina NGS platforms
Solutions to biotinylate sheared BAC (Maricic et al., 2010)
Primers: Sol_bridge_P5 and Sol_bridge_P7 (Maricic et al., 2010)
SeqCap EZ Hybridization and Wash Kit

manuscript_citation: Koganebuchi K, Gakuhari T, Takeshima H, Sato K, Fujii K, Kumabe T, Kasagi S, Sato T, Tajima A, Shibata H, Ogawa M, Oota H (2018) A new targeted capture method using bacterial artificial chromosome (BAC) libraries as baits for sequencing relatively large genes. PLoS ONE 13(7): e0200170. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0200170
guidelines: This targeted enrichment was conducted following the modified protocol of Maricic et al., (2010) and the NimbleGen technical note “Double Capture: High Efficiency Sequence Capture of Small Targets for use in SeqCap EZ Library, Applications on 454 Sequencing Systems.” Please get the two protocols and check those in detail.

components.data: Bait production
components.name: Section

components.data: Blocking oligonucleotide solutions (Maricic et al., 2010) and human Cot-1 DNA were added to the library solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Blocking oligonucleotide solutions (Maricic et al., 2010) and human Cot-1 DNA were added to the library solution.

components.data: BAC double capture (BDC)
components.name: Section

components.data: The solution was dried out using a heat block at 95C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The solution was dried out using a heat block at 95C.

components.data: BAC double capture (BDC)
components.name: Section

components.data: Hybridization buffer and formamide added to the dried DNA, and the mixture was suspended by vortex mixing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Hybridization buffer and formamide added to the dried DNA, and the mixture was suspended by vortex mixing.

components.data: BAC double capture (BDC)
components.name: Section

components.data: The suspended mixture was single-stranded using a heat block at 95C for 10 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The suspended mixture was single-stranded using a heat block at 95C for 10 min.

components.data: BAC double capture (BDC)
components.name: Section

components.data: Biotinylated BAC baits (500 ng) eluted by 4.5 μL PCR grade water was added to the single-stranded DNA mixture and mixed by pipetting.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Biotinylated BAC baits (500 ng) eluted by 4.5 μL PCR grade water was added to the single-stranded DNA mixture and mixed by pipetting.

components.data: BAC double capture (BDC)
components.name: Section

components.data: The solution was heated in a thermal cycler to 95C for 10 min and incubated at 65C overnight (12–16 h).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The solution was heated in a thermal cycler to 95C for 10 min and incubated at 65C overnight (12–16 h).

components.data: BAC double capture (BDC)
components.name: Section

components.data: Following incubation, Dynabeads M-270 Streptavidin (Invitrogen; CA, USA) was added to the hybridization mixture.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Following incubation, Dynabeads M-270 Streptavidin (Invitrogen; CA, USA) was added to the hybridization mixture.

components.data: BAC double capture (BDC)
components.name: Section

components.data: Bound DNA fragments were washed and eluted using NGS MagnaStand (Nippon Genetics, Tokyo, Japan).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Bound DNA fragments were washed and eluted using NGS MagnaStand (Nippon Genetics, Tokyo, Japan).

components.data: BAC double capture (BDC)
components.name: Section

components.data: After the wash and the elution, PCRs were run of the enriched library (26 μL) before removing magnetic beads. The 5 μL of the eluted library was used as a template for PCR in a 50 μL solution containing deoxynucleotide (dNTP) 0.3 mM, 0.5 μM of each primer, Sol_bridge_P5 and Sol_bridge_P7 in Maricic et al. (2010), 1.0 U of KAPA HiFi DNA Polymerase (Kapa Biosystems). The 1st post-capture PCR was carried out following the cycling reaction: an initial denaturing step at 98C for 2 min, 8 cycles of denaturation at 98C for 10 sec, annealing at 60C for 15 sec, extension at 68C for 50 sec.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After the wash and the elution, PCRs were run of the enriched library (26 μL) before removing magnetic beads. The 5 μL of the eluted library was used as a template for PCR in a 50 μL solution containing deoxynucleotide (dNTP) 0.3 mM, 0.5 μM of each primer, Sol_bridge_P5 and Sol_bridge_P7 in Maricic et al. (2010), 1.0 U of KAPA HiFi DNA Polymerase (Kapa Biosystems). The 1st post-capture PCR was carried out following the cycling reaction: an initial denaturing step at 98C for 2 min, 8 cycles of denaturation at 98C for 10 sec, annealing at 60C for 15 sec, extension at 68C for 50 sec.

components.data: BAC double capture (BDC)
components.name: Section

components.data: The PCR amplicon was purified using a MinElute PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The PCR amplicon was purified using a MinElute PCR Purification Kit (Qiagen).

components.data: BAC double capture (BDC)
components.name: Section

components.data: The 2nd capture was conducted using the enriched and purified library using the same steps as in the 1st capture. The 2nd post-capture PCR of the 2nd captured library was run in 13 cycles using the same cycling condition as in the 1st post-capture PCR.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The 2nd capture was conducted using the enriched and purified library using the same steps as in the 1st capture. The 2nd post-capture PCR of the 2nd captured library was run in 13 cycles using the same cycling condition as in the 1st post-capture PCR.
